New Records: Greece beat England for the first time in their history.
Greece scored at Wembley for the first time in their history.
Key Match Events: Vangelis Pavlidis scored twice to secure Greece's victory.
Jude Bellingham scored for England to level the match at 1-1.
Vangelis Pavlidis scored the winning goal in injury time (90+4).
England had a goal disallowed for offside.
England's Levi Colwill made an acrobatic goal-line clearance to prevent a goal.
England's Bukayo Saka was substituted due to injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Greece's Vangelis Pavlidis dedicated the victory to George Baldock, a former teammate.
England's coach Lee Carsley expressed disappointment and emphasized the need to respond well in future matches.
England's captain John Stones acknowledged Greece as the better team and expressed personal disappointment in the result.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Greece's players were visibly emotional, dedicating their victory to their late teammate George Baldock.
England's new system and strategy did not work as planned, leading to their defeat.
